info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 08 at 7:54PM PDT until May 08 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. * WHERE...The Willamette Pass, Diamond Lake, Crater Lake, Union Creek, and Lake of the Woods areas in the South Central Oregon Cascades. This includes portions of Highways 58, 62, 230, 138, and 140 in the Cascades. The Oregon Caves and Mount Ashland Ski Area in the Siskiyou Mountains will also be affected. * WHEN...Until 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slushy, slippery road conditions as well as the possibility of snow covered roads during periods of heavy snowfall. Road conditions could change quickly from wet to snow covered during periods of heavy snowfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While the high May sun angle will limit road accumulations on primary roadways much of the time, snowfall rates will exceed and inch per hour, at times, during periods of heavy snow in showers. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
